PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within Lafourche Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Prop. 1 -- PC - Art. III
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Charter Amendment Propositions
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 1

Summary:  Amendment to the Current Home Rule Charter of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana, as it pertains to residency requirement of the Parish Administrator and enacting certain other provisions in connection therewith.
Race.FullText:
Shall Article III, Organization, Structure and Distribution of Powers and Functions, Section 3 The Executive Branch, 
C. The Administrator, be amended to read as follows:  
"C.  The Administrator
The Administrator shall be the Chief Administrative Officer of the Parish and shall have such powers and perform such functions and duties as may be prescribed by this Charter or by ordinance or delegated by the President.  The Administrator shall be a qualified elector of the Parish and shall have been domiciled in the Parish for at least one (1) year prior to being nominated by the President for ratification by the Council. The Administrator shall be appointed and may be removed as provided for in Paragraph D 5 and 6 of this Section"?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW HRC Prop. 2 -- PC - Art. X
Race.SummaryText:
Charter Amendment Proposition No. 2

Summary:  Amendment to the Current Home Rule Charter of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana, to add transitional language to the Charter to be effective if Charter Amendment Proposition No. 1 on the November 6, 2012 ballot is approved.
Race.FullText:
Shall Article X Transitional Provision have an additional Section added thereto should Charter Amendment Proposition No. 1 on this ballot be approved, said Section to read as follows:
"Section 3.  Transitional Provision for Proposed Amendment of Article Ill, Section 3, Paragraph C 
If the proposed amendment to Article III, Section 3, Paragraph C is approved by a vote of the electors as provided for in Article IX of this Charter, then pursuant to Article IX, Section 3 of this Charter this amendment shall become effective on the tenth day after publication. On that date the Office of Administrator shall become vacant and thereafter shall be filled as provided for in Article III, Section 3, Paragraph 5 of this Charter"?
